content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --ELTM
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --TPTNUM
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --TPT
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --TPTREF
      operator: exists
Core:
  Id: CORE-000080
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT are not present in dataset,
  but --TPTREF is present.
Outcome:
  Message: --TPTREF is present when --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT are not present.
  Output Variables:
    - --TPTREF
    - --ELTM
    - --TPTNUM
    - --TPT
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0093
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The description of a time point that acts as a fixed
                  reference for a series of planned time points, used for study data
                  tabulation. Description of the fixed reference point referred to
                  by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, --TPT, --STINT, and --ENINT.
                Document: Model v2.0
                Section: Timing
                Item: --TPTREF
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT are not present in dataset, but --TPTREF is present.

Outcome.Message: --TPTREF is present when --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT are not present.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The description of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points, used for study data tabulation. Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, --TPT, --STINT, and --ENINT.
